oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Jackson descending the Mississippi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Print entitled "Jackson descending the Mississippi to examine the fortifications." Shows Andrew Jackson in a boat with other officers prior to the Battle of New Orleans.
After General Jackson's arrival in New Orleans in December 1815, he shored up fortifications around the city in preparation for a British assault.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Jackson, Andrew, 1767-1845
